content.description: This route is sustained with several cruxes. Follow a steep face to a crux above a roof, then climb an interesting layback flake to the anchors.
content.location:
This shares an anchor with

Block Party

which is just to the left.

content.description: This is a great route, heavy on the stems! Stem up the obvious corner straight up to the imposing roof. Clip an intermediate anchor and clip 5 or 6 more bolts through the jungle gym roof to the upper anchor. Don't try and lower with a 60m rope, use the midpoint anchor or a 70m.
content.protection:
Two (2) handfuls of draws.

Per

Highlander

: 16 quickdraws plus something for the anchors.
content.location: It is just past (100m) the mine shafts with the wood mining relics. Look for the big roof at the top of a nice corner.

content.description:
This route climbs the shallow corner through a steep bulge to small roof and subsequent headwall to the right of the

Deep End

. This is powerful and bouldery on small holds with some long reaches. It is rather beta intensive.

"See the morning sun

on the hillside.

If you not livin' good,

gotta travel wide...."
content.protection:
9 bolts to chain anchors. Bolts protect the cruxes well but are a little bit too spaced to provide convenient working of the crux from the ground. It is easiest to hang the draws and preview the route when lowering off from the

Deep End

.
content.location:
Start on the first three bolts of the

Deep End

before breaking right (straight up) for six bolts to the same anchor as

Deep End

.

content.description: It's so short it can't be that hard... right? Wrong, this little gem comes at you fast like a spider monkey. Pull onto the rock with a dubious, shale pinch and quickly move up to a big edge to clip the first bolt, phew. Now do a bunch of awkward moves, clipping a few bolts to a great little topout. Done.
content.protection: 5 draws plus whatever you like for the anchor (two Fixe rings).
content.location:
This is two routes to the left of

Svengali

, the first one with bolts. It's short and has 5 bolts.

content.description: This excellent route starts with some fun moves to get over a roof with a hand and finger crack. Easier techy climbing leads to a definite crux in the middle of the route with small crimps and gastons with marginal feet. A big rest after leads to easier but powerful climbing on big holds and laybacks. Get on it!
content.location:
This is the first route to the right of

Chip Shot

, and it starts below a roof with a finger / hand crack.

content.description: My Left Foot has tricky slab climbing with circuitous route finding. It is a fun route if you like slab.
content.location: This ascends the low angle slab 50 feet right of the mine.

content.description: Start by surmounting a steep roof to a ledge, scramble up to clip the next bolt, then traverse through cool pockets to a dihedral crux. This ends with a roof. It makes a good warmup for the adjacent harder routes.
content.location:
This is on the ledge left of

Svengali

.

content.description: Climb the grey slab to an out-of-character boulder problem crux. There is now an extension up the blunt arete to the top of the wall which is probably in the 11+ range. For the extension, use the midway anchor or a 70m rope.
content.location: This is right of My Left Foot on a narrow ledge.

content.description: Climb through a low roof (crux). Continue up past delicate flakes and edges to a two bolt anchor.
content.protection: 6 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
It is located at far right end of the Deep End.

Rappel from rings.

content.description: Start in a wide, left-facing, corner crack, clip a bolt and start traversing left to an arete. This has fun climbing up steep jugs to the anchor.
content.location:
It is two routes right of

Chip Shot

.

content.description: Begin just right of the Two Kids Mine, a prominent mine shaft with two holes, and old structures in the middle of the cliff.  Climb up a shallow corner on small edges.  Climbing to the anchor on the right is 10b, or continue through the roof for an 11a finish.
content.location: This is just North of Ouray across from the hot springs pool.  Park at the Pool (not the mini golf center) and walk up the drainage across the street to the left of the mini golf center.  There will be a gate and a NO TRESSPASSING sign.  Currently the landowner is allowing us to climb and the No Trespassing sign is for hikers on the Horsethief Trail.  The land from the approach gully to the Two Kids Mine is all on private property.  Take the trail going right out of the drainage.  Continue past an old mining sculpture below the mine and then take the next trail uphill to the cliff, cutting back left. A short scramble is required to reach a ledge, then traverse left to the start of the climb.

content.description:
This route begins with some cool steep pocket pulling up an overhanging arete to a thin crux above. It has great position and moves. This shares an anchor with

Mission Accomplished

, although it should probably have its own ending and anchor to make climbing and cleaning the route more user friendly.
content.location:
This is left of

Mission Accomplished

.

content.description: There are 2 routes next to 2 Kids Mine that have black hangers. This is the left hand one. Start with a bouldery corner to a roof with a scary glued block. Thin, technical stemming takes you through to easier terrain. Your belayer should wear a helmet, the rock is really good other than the reinforced hold.
content.location: This route has black bolts in a corner near 2 Kids Mine. This is the left route.

content.description:
This is a really fun route with great moves up top. Start 8' right of

Mission Accomplished

in a blocky, right-facing dihedral. The reachy crux is up high on some sweet sidepulls and rails.
